title: IT Business Consultant
job_description:
Job ID:  37655 |  Location:  Airoli, Maharashtra, India 
    
    
   Responsible for translating business requirements into detailed function specifications of the respective Sub-Domain. Is responsible for the delivery of global IT business application services, including consulting, projects and maintenance. 
    
     What will you be doing?  
   
   Development and implementation of Sub-Domain product  
   1.Setting up (customising) the corresponding systems configuration and documentation  
   2. Define project brief, initial cost assessment of projects, and the integration of other projects, and in potentially suppliers  
   3. Analyse, evaluate and define system requirements and change requests  
   4. Plan and monitor small and medium projects (incl. Resources) towards OTIF implementation of selected solution (On Time In Full) 
    
    
   Ensure effective support of Sub-Domain products  
   1. Responsible for the implementation of service/product roadmap, ensuring alignment with business needs  
   2. Responsible for specifying required service levels based on business criticality  
   3. Responsible to ensure that service levels are met  
   4. Responsible of deliver support/maintenance services according to agreed service levels and defined KPIs  
   5. Plans and coordinates project resources  
   6. Creation and development and/or implementation of user training/instruction  
   7. Does Monitoring of and assures ticket handling in accordance with defined service level 
    
    
   Increase of efficiency  
   1. Analyze the information requirements and information flows required to support better processes  
   2. Identify process waste and improve within given application to ensure better data quality/connectivity 
    
    
   Leadership / People Management  
   1. May lead a small team of IT Consultants in progressing the detail of the projects  
   2. Effectively manage vendors to maintain support and deliver new features in a cost effective manner. 
    
    
   What do we expect?  
   
   Education:  
   Higher education in a technical or business direction (e.g., computer science or MBA) at bachelor’s level or higher.  
   At least 5 years of experience in the application environment and development tools relevant to the job 
    
    
   Business experience:  
   More than 5 years of experience with relevant IT systems.  
   Good consulting and project management skills, is familiar with an international, multi- cultural environment  
   If needed: Specific SubDomain relevant knowledge 
    
    
   Additional Qualifications:  
   Languages: Good written and spoken English is a must, other international languages desired  
   International Cross-Culture experience  
   Can deal with constantly changing problems, processes and technologies  
   Works independently and proactively  
   Communicative, initiates and maintains contacts with relevant business partners  
   Analytical thinking, argues convincingly and fact-based 
    
    
   What´s in it for you?  
   
   
    Be part of an amazing team, who will be there to support you.  
    A forward-looking company, with a culture of innovation and a strong portfolio in sustainable technologies.  
    Long term growth opportunity  
    Employee Wellbeing & Assistance Program  
    Work-Life Balance  
    Hybrid Work Model  
    On-site Recreation Center  
    30 Days Annual Paid Leaves  
    In-house Gym  
    Subsidized Cafeteria Meals  
    Centralized Company Transport For Designated Routes  
    On-site Employee Health Center  
    Group Medical Insurance  
    Day Care facility (100% sponsored by Clariant)  
    Inclusive Work Environment  
    Ongoing Professional Development Opportunities  
    Approachable Leadership  
    Speak Up Culture 
   
    
    
     
   
   Clariant is a focused, sustainable and innovative specialty chemical company based in Muttenz near Basel/Switzerland. On 31 December 2021, Clariant totaled a staff number of 11 537 and recorded sales of CHF 4.372 billion in the fiscal year for its continuing businesses. The company reports in three business areas: Care Chemicals, Catalysis and Natural Resources. Clariant’s corporate strategy is led by the overarching purpose of ‘Greater chemistry – between people and planet’ and reflects the importance of connecting customer focus, innovation, sustainability, and people. Join us and help create sustainable value through chemistry for customers all over the globe.

title: Information Technology (IT) Manager
job_description:
Company 
   thyssenkrupp nucera is the beginning of a new era defined by clean energy supply with green hydrogen at industrial scale. thyssenkrupp nucera offers world-leading technologies for high-efficiency electrolysis plants. The company, a Joint Venture with Industrie De Nora, has extensive in-depth knowledge in the engineering, procurement, construction and commissioning of electrochemical plants and a strong track record of more than 600 projects with a total rating of over 10 gigawatts already successfully installed. With its water electrolysis technology to produce green hydrogen, the company offers an innovative solution on an industrial scale for green value chains and an industry fueled by clean energy – a major step towards climate-neutrality.  
   Your responsibilities  
   As a IT Manager, you will be responsible for user support for thyssenkrupp nucera India. 
  
    You are responsible for maintenance of infrastructure, applications, etc. to ensure secure IT operations 
    You will co-ordinate with external service providers, e.g., hardware and software 
    You are responsible for License management 
    You will co-ordinate global co-operation with head office in Germany as well as other international sites of thyssenkrupp nucera 
    You will be responsible for Procurement and supply of IT hardware and software for local requirements. 
    You will report security weaknesses and enforce all available IT security measures as specified by the head office. 
    The incumbent will be co-ordinating with Indian as well as German Management Team on various IT related topics. 
   
   Your profile  
  
   Engineering Graduate in Computer, Information Technology or related fields 
    The candidate should have experience in plant design and plant building companies 
    6-8 years’ experience in maintaining IT Infrastructure including operating systems, security tools, applications, servers, email systems, laptops, desktops, software, and hardware, etc. 
    Fluency in English 
    Project Management skills 
    Can do attitude and problem solving skills 
   
   Your benefits with us  
  
    Electrolysis - Green Hydrogen & Chlor Alkali Technology Provider for a livable planet. 
    Working on Global clients. 
    You will be part of new establishment for upcoming generation. 
    Company believes in Innovation and Employee Empowerment. 
    Excellent work culture

title: IT Procurement Buyer | 6 to 9 years | Mumbai
job_description:
Job Description 
   
   
    
      Considerable knowledge of purchasing practices including best verses lowest price quote, closed bid process, total cost of purchase, cost savings of purchases.  
     Good knowledge of competitive vendor base across all IT Hardware / Software categories across APAC 
      Market knowledge on IT Sourcing. 
      Process orientation person and aligning to the Procurement Process and policy. 
      Good understanding of PR to PO process and working experience in basic ERP for Supply Chain / Procurement. 
      Experience in managing RFP's , RFI , RFQ's and Reverse Auctions 
      Extensive experience in supplier relationship management and establishing supplier performance management framework 
      Knowledge on supplier due diligence & on boarding process and tools 
      Excellent skill in supplier negotiations and negotiation strategies 
      Hands on experience on source selection techniques and fair value requirements 
      Knowledge on local tax and regulations related to procurement.

      Minimum of 6-9 years' experience in sourcing, buying and supply chain management. Preferably dealing with Asia Countries. 
      Experience in managing supplier interactions and ideally some experience in reviewing contracts 
    
   
  
  
   
     Secondary Skill 
   
   
    
      Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to work effectively with colleagues, suppliers, and customers 
      Analytical skills in evaluating supplier terms, comparing prices, and benchmarking data 
      Ability to influence stakeholders and negotiate with suppliers 
      Ability to collaborate and work with global teams.

title: IT Manager
job_description:
CORO India is seeking a skilled and dedicated IT Manager to join our organization. As the technical backbone of the organization, the IT Manager will play a crucial role in managing and optimizing our IT infrastructure.
  
  
   
     Location : Chembur, Mumbai, Maharashtra, India.  
   
   
    Skills & Expertise:  
    Proficient in Google Workspace Admin and Microsoft 365 Admin, with hands-on experience in using their administration tools and features.  
    Skilled in managing Team Shared drives on Google Drive and OneDrive, facilitating efficient file sharing and collaboration.  
    Capable of conducting comprehensive research to identify suitable technology solutions  based  on functionality, scalability, and cost-effectiveness  
    Familiar with managing technology vendors, including selection, contract negotiation, and ongoing relationship management.  
    Knowledgeable in data backup solutions, both online and offline.  
    Proficient in updating IT policies and procedures to align with current technology standards and regulations.  
    Providing general IT support to employees, addressing technical concerns, and assisting with software and hardware installations.  
    Supporting and maintaining the organization’s IT infrastructure, including hardware, software, and network systems.  
    Troubleshooting and resolving technical issues to ensure the smooth operation of computer systems and applications.  
    Assisting in the implementation and maintenance of software applications such as HRMS systems.  
    Qualifications:   
    Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.  
    2-4 years of experience in managing IT infrastructure and providing technical support.  
    Strong knowledge and practical experience in managing IT infrastructure and providing technical support.  
    Proficiency in administering Google Workspace and Microsoft Office 365.  
    Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving and troubleshooting abilities.  
    Good to have experience and skills:   
    Background in data management streamlining, including the ability to analyze existing data processes, identify inefficiencies, and implement improvements to enhance data accuracy, accessibility, and security.  
    Salary:   
    The salary for this role will be  based  on the candidate’s experience and past salary, with a salary range of 30,000 to 40,000 INR. For exceptional candidates, the salary can go up to 50,000 INR.  
    Send in your detailed resume to careers@coroindia.org with the Subject of the email “IT Manager”. Only shortlisted resumes will be contacted.
